definitions.definition: Decoration; especially, decoration placed along edges or borders.
definitions.example: Paint the house white with blue trim.

definitions.definition: A haircut, especially a moderate one to touch up an existing style.
definitions.example: I went to the hairdresser for a trim but came back nearly bald.

definitions.definition: Dress; gear; ornaments.
The manner in which something is equipped or adorned; order; disposition.
definitions.example: The car comes in three different trims.

definitions.definition: Sexual intercourse.
The fore-and-aft angle of the vessel to the water, with reference to the cargo and ballast; the manner in which a vessel floats on the water, whether on an even keel or down by the head or stern.
The arrangement of the sails with reference to the wind.
To reduce slightly; to cut; especially, to remove excess.
definitions.example: A ranch steak is usually trimmed of all excess fat.

definitions.definition: To decorate or adorn; especially of a Christmas tree.
definitions.example: They traditionally trim the tree on Christmas Eve.

definitions.definition: (of an aircraft) To adjust pitch using trim tabs.
(of a vessel) To modify the angle relative to the water by shifting cargo or ballast; to adjust for sailing; to assume, or cause to assume a certain position, or trim, in the water.
(of a vessel's sails) To modify the angle (of the sails) relative to the wind, especially to set them at the most advantageous angle.
To balance; to fluctuate between parties, so as to appear to favour each.
To make trim; to put in due order for any purpose; to make right, neat, or pleasing; to adjust.
(of timber) To dress; to make smooth.
To rebuke; to reprove.
To beat or thrash.
Physically fit.
definitions.example: He goes jogging every day to keep in trim.

definitions.definition: Slender, lean.
Neat or smart in appearance.
In good order; properly managed or maintained.
With sails well trimmed.
